Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. That's a really big slice!
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Giant bottle of red wine.... Pay what you drink!

5jx3w1CTeoeinMOy5RjAFg.text: Delicious pizza -- highly recommend coming with a group of 3-4 for a pie or grabbing a slice to take away. I really enjoyed the chorizo, corn, and coriander. Make sure to get half/half so you can optimize for other pizzas-- also enjoyed the aubergine, cauliflower cheese, spinach, and harissa.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Half aubergine, cauliflower cheese, and pepper half chorizo, corn, and coriander

8FqSCwduokB9Ih9B3XVJFA.text: This place is a  MUST!!! Yeah, there's a little bit of a wait but it's sooo worth it. A 20 inch pizza sounded intimidating at first but then, my husband and I finished the entire thing. We highly recommend ordering half Salami, rocket and Parmesan and half mushroom, ricotta, pumpkin seed and chili. You'll leave satisfied!

DCVQIm4UT3kCgPQv2Pq_8A.text: Homeslice in Neal's Yard has become one of those must-stop, must-eat destinations in London. The 1st time I stopped here on a Sunday evening around 3 pm and the line was out of the door with crowds milling about. I ran away.Went back at what I thought was an odd time (Monday afternoon 2 pm) and it was still packed but I managed to get a small spot to sit in after a 10 minute wait. The service was fast and efficient and since I was alone I chose one of the pizza  slices. Delicious slices (4 GBP) - you have to choose from 3 options if you're getting the slice - the Margerita, the lamb shoulder or courgette and artichoke. I chose the last one was I love artichokes and more people should be using them in their food. I was super hungry so didn't manage to get a picture, but it was really wholesome, light and delicious. The crust was thin & salty and I dipped mine in the chili oil kept on the table and savored every bite. Definitely go and try some pizza if you get a chance - it's excellent.

xyr_uogCMLfCeiwCdYmlnw.text: Homeslice has been a go-to pizza place whenever friends come in from out of town. I'm mainly a fan of the classics, margherita or salami, but friends seem to like the variety. The other great thing about this place is the wine. They come in these huge green bottles and pay for what you drink. This can be dangerous when with a group of friends! Although Neal's Yard is a great location, it doesn't take bookings and the line/queue can get long. So either order a slice to go or you can book ahead at one of their other locations.

PEQdmGpUCmkRmgvQBgUv9w.text: This place is simply amazing. Was in London on vacation and needed a quick meal after catching a show in the west end and stumbled upon Homeslice. The restaurant is almost alive, you can feel the pulse of the place the second you step over the threshold l. Tucked away off the Main Street in Neal's Yard Homeslice is a slice of culinary heaven. The heat of the coal fire pizza oven blasts your face as you push open the door and the music blasts into your ears. You have two ordering options a selection of unique pizza's by the slice or a 20 inch pizza you may choose to order half and half. Our party opted for a 20inch and chose two pizzas to split down the middle. We had the Aborigine and Cauliflower and the Salami and rocket choosing from the two a favorite is an impossibility.  The crust is thin and crisp yet also soft and doughy almost like a naan, the unique blend of flavors is perfection on all accounts. Having only sampled the two we had I can not speak to the full menu however from what I did sample I'm certain you can't go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Auborgine and cauliflower and salami and rocket.

zRd28qWo7XarZfi7XE3V5A.text: I visited Homeslice with three of my friends, and we had a really great meal!Despite how busy it was (a packed house with a big wait list), we enjoyed our visit and the pizza was really good. The slices are extremely difficult to pick up, since the crust is paper thin. The ingredients were really fresh, and the hostess and waitress were very polite. They were also very attentive when it came to making sure we had plenty of water and napkins throughout our meal, despite how busy everything was. The most inconvenient part of our visit was how tight the space was. I felt like I could barely move, and the table was so small that it was hard to fit two pizzas on it without having to adjust your elbows or plate accordingly.

XdwfpSMqZU_bZ9IBZzHcJQ.text: Recommended by a friend and definitely met my already high expectations. Pizza was huge. We did a half and half between two people and only had two small slices to take home. We did the salami, rocket, Parmesan and ricotta, mushroom, pumpkin seeds and chili both of which were excellent! Definitely recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom

VvPmVXMN_j9etc97_h8LQA.text: So good! You won't regret coming here. The pizza here is light and crispy and oh so good. The pizza flavor breaks free from the norm and spices things up with herbs and exotic spices, making even a mushroom pizza taste fresh and savory. Pro tip order takeaway to avoid the long queue, and you can still find a table outside the restaurant.

mKwyIZ9k3GxnFf0CbKXZbw.text: Amazing pizza, fantastic atmosphere!!  We're from the USA and thoroughly enjoyed it!!

gdiqtjpimfV9f92_QeE4UQ.text: Love love love this location!I am pizza lover! I can eat any kind of pizza but for sure know the difference between the good and bad pizza.The wait was over a an hour on a Tuesday night but it does worth it.It's small and crowded but still worth it.We ordered the lamb pizza which was incredible.It was so different and yummy.Try that pizza if you are in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Yummy pizza!

5FZi7T3V8QKJl-sy6bxFiA.text: Love it.  First the location is dynamite and it looks to be straight out of a movie set in Neal's yard.  It's just awesome.  They have a great variety of pizzas from standard margherita to a pumpkin seems mushroom concoction which was fantastic.  Had an olive/anchovy pizza with Carmelita's onions. Fantastic.  You'll wait but it's worth it.  They let you do half/half on a pizza which really allows you to explore.  Staff pleasant.  Service pretty quick.  They take Amex.  Been multiple times.  Very pleased every time.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Half margherita, half mushroom/ricotta/pumpkin seed/chili.  Stellar

8_8WIS5LhclvORVr-hVIXg.text: Located at Neal's Yard close to my favorite breakfast place 26 Grains.  Home slice was hopping at 6 pm.  The wait for a table was 45 minutes.  We decided to order takeaway instead. We wanted a vegetarian pizza.  We ordered a twofer - half of the pizza was the Mushroom, Ricotta and Pumpkin Seed pizza while the other half had Aubergine (Eggplant in the USA), Cauliflower and Harissa.I liked the Mushroom Pizza more but the Aubergine Pizza was also excellent.Excellent Pizzas, thin wood fired crusts, great fresh ingredients.We bought Salads and Apple Cider from the nearby M& S to complete the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. TakeAway Pizza - Mushroom with Ricotta and Pumpkin Seeds on one side.  Aubergine , Cauliflower and Harissa on the other.

UfC1rxtXA0Lma48NonXapQ.text: Saw the reviews and just had to try this place. Restaurant is not that big but can sit quite a few diners, which means the tables have to be shared. We waited 15 mins to sit but we went on a Sunday and arrived at the resto at 16:00. Menu has limited choices, but I believe that when the menu is small, the restaurant specialises on the quality of the product and taste. We ordered the half and half pizza - half salami, parmesan cheese & rocket leaves and the other half is mushroom, ricotta, pumpkin seeds & chilli flakes. Their pizza is enormous (thank goodness we were starving!). Good for two people to share. Both sides were good but I enjoyed the mushroom side much more. And because of the size of the pizza, the dough in the middle is not as crispy as I would like it to be. Apart from that, think it's a pretty good pizza place overall. Although not as mind blowing as I thought it would be.

Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Menu (Sept 2017)
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Half salami, Parmesan and rocket leaves and half mushroom, ricotta, pumpkin seeds and chilli flakes

rxvEvGfC6Q9zhcElMGVTRg.text: Probably the best restaurant we tried in London - one pizza is £20 and plenty to feed 3 people. Not many places in the city you can get a full sit-down meal for £7 and it was some of the best pizza I've tried anywhere! We ordered two for a group of six - the chorizo and corn (which was surprisingly good) and another one with sausage and parmesan. Would recommend both!  The menu is small with six pizza options so it's easy to choose.The service was also great - our waitress was very chatty and took the time to have a conversation with our group given we were from out of town. As for the restaurant itself, the atmosphere was pretty casual yet pretty lively with good music and an open kitchen. There's plenty of tables but I'm sure it gets packed during peak hours. Overall a great place for dinner, especially for young people on a budget that would still like a full meal in a nice setting!

QQDS8-i3hVp8AmPgthUNew.text: This place is so ridiculously good!  The pizza is great value if you don't buy slices (just get the whole one for 20quid  - you'll totally finish it ;)All the toppings are yummy, with I think the mushroom being my favourite (esp with that drizzle of balsamic). They also have interesting stuff like cauli-cheese - healthy and weird...This is more Italian style pizza, with thin almost papery bases - not crunchy based NY-stylee.It is of course messy! As the best pizzas are.. And totally will put you in a food-coma - totes worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Nyom, get the mushroom!

sXwnhKmx8JXJ_GE-xMg2sQ.text: Their mushroom pizza and Margherita remains my favorite and the fact they continue to do slices in super convenient! The crust is thin and crispy and the flavors work well together!! They don't do slices on their other varieties but I'd love to try those (cant really order a pie as it's massive)

_ktncJmIluFnKI-dB1Lt1g.text: Great atmosphere, with upbeat employees. The service was good and the food came out quickly. I love that you can split the pizza down the middle and get two different styles of pizza, so you don't have to settle on something you might not like when sharing with someone.My boyfriend and I got the Wild Venison w/ Onion, Kale and Dukkah on half and Mushroom, Pumpkin Seed and Chili (No Ricotta) on the other half. It had to have been one of the biggest pizzas I have ever witnessed, so I was quite in shock when it came out. I ate a lot more than I thought I could, I think because it was thinner crust and not greasy at all. I left feeling satisfied and full, rather than overly stuffed. Also, this restaurant is in a cute little area called Neal's Yard, which was so colorful and picturesque.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Half: wild venison, with onion, kale and dukkah and half: mushroom, pumpkin seed and chili (no ricotta)

pdiICXqqO7jbdNUNWeKO3A.text: While meandering through Neil's Yard we saw Homeslice and were intrigued. Could a couple from New York (New Jersey technically) who have also traveled to Naples and had multiple delicious pizzas in their life fined a decent slice in London? Sound pretentious don't I. Well let me tell you the answer is a resounding yes!We arrived around 20.30 on a Sunday night and had about a 8 minute wait for a table. The place was hopping. The menu is vary straight forward...pies are one size, you can get certain combinations on a 1/2 and 1/2 and some come by the slice. We opted for half MUSHROOM, RICOTTA, PUMPKIN SEED & CHILI and half PROVISIONS' 4 CHEESE, JALAPEÑO SALSA & RYE CRUMB. The pie came out in no time and was amazing. The crust was of a perfect thickness to support all the toppings when you lifted it and had just the right amount of char on it from the oven. The base "sauce" on this was garlic oil which provided just the right balance to all the toppings. The earthiness of the various mushrooms with the slight crunch of the pumpkin seed and touch of chili was a great compliment to the richness of the 4 cheeses and salsa which was not a burning hot one so no worries there. The rye crumb was nice, they somewhat mimicked bacon bits, but for me were not needed.We were only two people and when the pie came (they leave it on the peel and you serve yourself right from that) it literally took up the entire table. These are huge pies but despite that I know I could have had more. That's not a critique on them, it's more about my insatiable appetite for good pizza. This place is a must stop for any pizza lover and my personal goal is now to try every combination they can possibly serve. I love this place!

FisGUuxIPJaJkenuiTk9CQ.text: Waited an hour for a 3 top. Worth every minute. Tried a half margherita / mushroom and ricotta. Crust is thin and amazingly light; crisped to perfection. Can't choose which of the toppings was better; both were super flavorful and understated (not too much sauce or overpowering ingredients). I've eaten pizza in hundreds of restaurants spanning two continents (including several trips to the motherland) and this is probably the best pizza I've ever had.

o7I1EmHLjhIpBeaFbNgbgw.text: We were exploring Neal's Yard and decided to stop at Homeslice for lunch. It's a small pizza place where they bake their pizzas to order in their wood fire oven. They offer pizzas by the slice or whole pizzas. They also have an option where you can put two different types of pizza on the same pizza. We decided on getting pizzas by the slice. We both ordered a slice of margherita and a slice or proscuitto, parmesean, and arugula. The slices came out fairly quickly; everything cooks fast in a super hot oven. The pizza was delicious and very filling. The slices are big and two filled us both up. Crust was perfect and good balance of sauce and toppings. Homeslice is cozy with a mix of communal tables and separate tables as well. Service is good; they were busy but they moved fast and made sure we had what we needed.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Margarita pizza and rocket, salami, and Parmesan pizza

j-_pXdwSjJOFyzOxMD0oxw.text: Ordered the Salami, Rocket and Parmesan 20" Pizza to takeout. The wait for a table is 2 hours and the place is small. Pretty ridiculous... Takeout is definitely the way to go. Takes around 20mins to get your order.The pizza was really good! I would say 20" is perfect for 3-4 people for £20 it's super cheap.The crust was crispy and had the prefect amount of toppings on top. The toppings itself are of exceptionally amazing quality! It's really a bargain for what you are getting. Just the downside is the wait to eat on the premises...

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Rocket, Salami and Parmesan 20" pizza

6L68qVTUqJ6M1o9qPmFiTw.text: I've been dreaming about getting back to this place. Really great pizza that was an out of the ordinary combination (or tails on pizza)!!! So delicious

lERSrN_vj_el7uzb7oDHIA.text: Best pizza I have ever had.  I'm a traveler who has to have pizza wherever I go. I've had a good amount of diverse choices when it comes to pizza.  I have to say that Homeslice is now number 1 on my list.  I really enjoyed the Salami pizza.  Their crust texture is just right, doesn't get soggy but not over burnt.  I like the NY style slice they had.  Prices were also very reasonable and customer service was a plus! I will definitely be going back when I return to London.

HeG2siyXB5qOlu9Jt7aUJw.text: We were visiting from Hawai'i and decided to get pizza. This popped up on yelp and we decided to grab a pie. Best decision ever! We got a half and half. Both were great decisions!  It was a huge pie. We also ordered it as a take away since it was Friday night and super busy!

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom

0qID4rWVACtP41wH8XG_pw.text: Cute shop, music a bit too loud, atmosphere a bit too busy, service a bit too inattentive, with just okay pizza. The evolving menu is limited with about 6-8 pizza types (but some inventive combos), of which only three types you can get by the slice. I found the slices to be wayyy too floppy (the crust was thin but not crispy). The flavors were good, not excellent.  It was just hard to enjoy such thin, floppy pizza. Price was okay given the location, but I wouldn't come back.

RonlMkNmOD1-SgKG_e0CIQ.text: it only took 5 min to get the pizza after we ordered!service was great, pizza is extremely thin and has more marinara than cheese. it's slightly different than american pizza but i enjoyed it. 4 stars only because it is extremely crowded and tiny. beware, no ac here.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom

BQX4MjOkNht1hp45tFlNSg.text: Needed an afternoon snack (prego here!) and walking through Neal's Yard, we noticed Homeslice. It smelled delicious and pizza seemed to fit the bill and my mood. I didn't necessarily want an entire pizza and my husband was adamant he wasn't hungry to share one with me so I went for the slice. Perfect. This pizza is very floppy and about the size of a NY pizza so you have to eat it like one too - folded in half. It was perfectly salted with the cheese underneath the sauce. I saw a few people opt for several slices with different topping than go for one whole 20" pizza. I may have done that, too if I was hungry enough. It wasn't too crowded when we dropped by but this could have been because it was in between lunch and dinner time. To avoid lengthy queues you might want to do the same.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Seated outside of the restaurant

OFAHgTmqu05JA_d9i81tPQ.text: Phenomenal pizza spot in London, no question about it. I did not have a chance to try any of the whole pie's, but grabbed the "Marghertia", "Salami, Rocket & Parmesan", and Mushroom, Ricotta, Pumpkin Seed & Chilli" slices to go. All three were amazing and worth it. Order, fold, eat style pizza.

GhCz7QvWSvSiajJQ0ztf6g.text: Good tasting huge pizzas.. really hard to get a table so quite along wait. But the worst thing if you are actually staying there is the noise level. Why do hip restuarants keep increasing the volumen when more people arrive. It was absoletely impossible to have a normal conversation due to this. You could only shout to the person in front of you.Lover the volume and this would be a great place but right now it is a torture chamber. Will never go there again.

YlLWxaRiTN29WkISYwy42A.text: I came to this pizzeria with high expectations about the 'NY style Pizza' and was left very......VERY dissappointedThe cheese was cheesy and the sauce had tomato in itWhat do you mean?I think there is many areas in the pizza game this place can improve but as for now I think that I will stick with Pizza Hut for the proper NY slice

3xvCf3vbmTGMuTYSZcPCxA.text: Only got one quick mergherita slice, and while I had somewhat mixed feelings, I ended up liking it in the end. It almost looks like a New York slice because it's so big, but really this is an oversized Neapolitan -- the undercarriage isn't floppy but basically right above the borderline of sufficiently stable, and the crust is super fluffy. The tomatoes and basil did their job, but it was really the last few bites at the end (when the crust became a factor) that really brought me back into positive territory with this slice.With all the amazing pizza back home, it's hard to say I'd seek this out on a trip to London, but it's good nonetheless.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Margherita

uUInRXtIOzI14j4OHAZjMw.text: Great pizza, great wine, great atmosphere and awesome vibe.  What more can I say. I found this place while watching youtube videos of places to visit while in London. Glad I came across it. We actually ate there our first night in London and came back and ordered a pizza to go on another night.  Glad I found it!

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Awesome grapefruity beer

O7mdWGZ3TLMcIkspTb9zyA.text: One of the best pizzas I've had in London so far!My friend and I shared a full pie of half salami, rocket & parmesan, and half mushroom, ricotta, pumpkin seed & chili with garlic oil. The pizza was huge (20") but we ended up finishing the whole thing because it was so good! The combination of toppings are pretty unique and delicious! I can taste the quality of the ingredients used and they were generous with it too. The pizza crust is bubbly and thin. It's not exactly like a New York thin crust but I'm still a fan. I'd definitely come back to try all the other ones!

y3Dg2apQ7B9VTF4l3GrukA.text: They know how to make yummy pizza!Expect a long wait for a table but trust me is worth it. The menu is short, just a couple of options to choose but I think is great! That means the ingredients are fresh ;) We ordered half chorizo corn and salami arugula ... delicious!! If you around Covent Garden this a good place to stop by

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Big pizza enough for 4 ppl

ptfcSftyYIIzunfS6KyZFQ.text: Amazing flavor with an awesome crust!! Cute ambiance and great service!! I wish I had room for a whole pie where they will do half and half choices to share!

ijEa0Jryu7AqikMXFFvWZw.text: Fast is the best thing you can say about the pizza. Not great flavor or crust. Also very light on the topping selections on all orders. You have to scavenge for them and share with your guests. They will do well as the location is fantastic. Servers are fine and pleasant but mostly interested in socializing with each other vs serving customers.

pc7eSof9yRYztlHsXW9dmQ.text: The pizzas are large and paper thin. Excellent example of pizzas from Napoli. Great marinara sauce, fresh ingredients, lively atmosphere, and fun music is wonderful. A bit loud, but not a problem. Younger crowd in general - college crowd. Will definitely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. The circumference of the 20" pizza is accurate.

jlCSCmGWTyeZri1KPCEhig.text: Eh. Crazy crowded. Pizza was sub par. Not a bad spot if you go with friends and plan on sharing a couple pies. Good for friends. Not for food.

X3nSyX5UZBRxAc_K72AFCA.text: What a great discovery!  Actually the whole little Neal's Yard area is pretty amazing.  We came here after a matinee of Matilda (just down the road).  So, basically, it was a perfect day.  We sat at a communal table and ate an amazing pizza.  Definitely get a full pie and do half of one topping and half of another.  We did the one with salami to satisfy my carnivore son and one with mushrooms to satisfy his veggie loving twin.  The only negative is the pizza slicer is ridiculously dull (maybe for liability reasons).  The pizza looked and smelled so heavenly and the cutter was pretty useless, so I had to restrain myself from tearing the pizza into shreds to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Yes the pizza is that huge!!!
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. The menu

folu7gfN3KBG4uIF9fELKA.text: Really amazing pizzeria in London! It says it all when locals and tourists alike are waiting in line because the entire eatery is packed with pizza lovers!They have simple and trendy pizza options, ranging from a classic Margherita Pizza to the more specialty toppings like Lamb and Cabbage Pizza.These were actually the two pizzas we chose to indulge our pizza cravings with. The pizza dough was truly amazing! It had that chewy texture, ultra thin, and perfect. The only thing that I did not enjoy was how little of the toppings they put on the pizza, but I know it's because the pizza itself was too thin to put anymore toppings on them for it to be handled.For the price (18~20£ // $24-$27) a pie, it was not a fair price. However, because it is in a prime location, with such great pizza dough, I'm sure it's fair in that sense.The workers are super friendly, and attentive! They hustle really hard! Had an amazing time.On a side note, the outdoor seating is at a first sit first serve basis. So sit as soon as you see someone leaving. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Homeslice!

7ZuggdjbFqZWQidLXtJhyQ.text: Not to sound like that bitch, but this place is kind of over rated. My first friend in London (who's taste I now question) said these exact words "This is the best pizza London has to offer! Even better than American pizza and a close second to Italy". Maybe it was the beers that were talking when she told me this or my HIGH expectations, but these pizzas are only good because of the creative flavors and large size (one pizza can serve 3 people). But my biggest reservation of Homeslice is the sub par service, the lack of sauce, and inconsistency of pizzas. The first time I came, I ordered the corn and chorizo and the brisket pizza and it was amazing! It was also cool that you could do half and half on their pizzas. Second and third time around, these were the shittiest pizzas. Barely any sauce and lack of flavor. To be safe, I would stick with their mushroom or rocket pizza (which are very reliable!). Also, the queue is at least 1 hour during dinner time and there is no seating to wait. Yelper's Note: Me and this friend are no longer friends. Not because of this pizza choice, but because they cannot hold their liquor and probably thought this place was amazing because she always comes here drunk.

ahFXEDsf-aZUd2bEwBUoWQ.text: Good NY style pizza. They get 4 stars instead of 5 because our single slices came out a little cold. I would recommend ordering a whole pie so it comes out fresh. Service was friendly and efficient. I would go back for more.

1v5NJEn2myTPbeu13-l2-Q.text: You know, I wasn't as impressed as I thought I would be. Came here on a Wednesday evening in April and the restaurant was packed. We put our name in and hung out in Neal's Yard for nearly 45 minutes before we realized we could've just ordered slices to go!After realizing this, we went back to the hostess and ordered four pizza slices for take away. We waited maybe another 10-15 minutes and then was finally given our pizza. We both got the same thing, a slice of margherita and a slice of salami, rocket and Parmesan. We then ate at the benches in Neal's Yard. The margherita was pretty good! I really enjoyed the dough, it was tasty. The sauce was alright and there could've been WAY more cheese. The salami was good too but it was spicy! I couldn't really separate the flavors either between the salami, rocket or Parmesan. My favorite was the margherita but I won't really be rushing back here. It was honestly only OK pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Salami with rocket and Parmesan

toPIciBSr_AlioyCsW3-OA.text: Easily the best pizza I've ever eaten. Honestly I'm not kidding. It's incredible. Run. Don't walk. Run. It's also in a beautiful location. Really fun place.  I highly recommend it.  And the staff are lovely too. Good vibe. Pop music. Fun crowd.  two big thumbs up.

AA17DkENzwlAy-d3z_pWfQ.text: If you are home sick for a NY slice them this is the spot.  Great location in a small quart yard.  We had rented a loft just above this place and we couldn't have been more happy.  Pizza is spot on if you are a thin NY style fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Slice yourself

yCzXnBQuD7ba9_HtEfeQbQ.text: Came to Homeslice at lunch time and were able to get a spot for three at a table, which I was surprised about! There is a line to order pizza, but most are getting it to take away and return to work or eat in the public courtyard! We ordered most of the available slice options- they have a more extensive menu but only four options are available by the slice. We had margherita, salami topped with rocket and Parmesan and mushroom slice! The crust was PERFECT- I was very impressed. Honestly our salami pizza was a bit cold but the flavor was great, the fresh Parmesan was plentiful on this pizza. The margherita was not my favorite, but it wasn't terrible- if you typically like the simple slices, you'll like it! Mushroom- also delicious! We finished some sodas and ended up ordering three slices of salami as we were still a bit hungry! These slices were FRESH, so they were hot and steamy and they were delicious! I would definitely recommend stopping here, we almost got this again because it was so good, kind of wish we did!

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom

dQsNpPptLzTxStDGBJoXaA.text: Decide to try this pizza place based on my BFF who saw this place on a NYC travel/food station.Located in Covent Garden section of London in Neal's Yard. Arrived at about 5:15 pm on Saturday, and the wait was 1:20. Took our names and told us to return around 6:10., since I didn't have a local cell to give.Returned about 6:15 and it took about 5 minutes to be seated.Small space with picnic type tables. The menu is on the blackboard and it's a 20 inch pizza for 20 pounds. The pizza is thin like a crepe with a crust and pizza ingredients. It's really delicious.It's really still good when it gets cold. Can't eat a 20 inch pizza too quick. I'd recommend trying this place. It's really for the under 30 crowd in my opinion. Really tasty pizza

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom

tOOONdJ6fdbLYldhoU-6-w.text: Really great find for when we were walking by Neals Yard dairy. Only been open 8 weeks as of this review. Go behind the alley and you will find a fantastic pizza. Great unusual pies as well as the traditional fare. My ass is getting bigger just eating all the pies. You can eat in or take out. We carried out and ate in the courtyard on a rare beatiful London night. We did not have but heard the ox tail and horseradish was great. Ours were the Rocket and Italian Salami ( forgot the correct name) and the Margherita.  FANTASTIC!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Menu is great. Regular and unusual but tasty pies
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. View from the courtyard

5wmNJx_SGv2ft74vbcVyvQ.text: This is quite possibly the best pizza I've had in my life. Definitely the best within recent memory. I came here twice with my whole family. The first time we had a half oxtail half margherita pizza and it was amazing, but bewarned - it's a bit messy! Also it's a rather small place so there is often a wait outside, so come during non-peak times! The second time we came it was around 2:00 on a Friday so we had to wait for around 25 minutes, but oh was it worth it. Oxtail was again my favorite, but we also tried the salami and it was delicious. If you have a craving for pizza, this is the place!

zODvEkeYKG_ZkUYf8P7AWg.text: What a gem of a place! Casual shabby chic decor with a wood fire pizza oven. Pizza's are a huge 20inches of gorgeous mouth watering loveliness.  Fab price point at £20 a pizza which easily feeds 3 or £4 a slice.  Friendly staff, affordable, yummy and so worth a visit. Xoxo

LqOeNwUajK_DqTjuhwJ5bg.text: Absolutely delicious but it doesn't travel well.  Did takeaway and walked 10 minutes at night and - though I literally had seen my pie come out of the oven - it was cold at home.  Will definitely go after a show and have a seat, a slice and a beer.  The beef with carrot, etc., is fantastic!

TagVm9PykW1-lWXLwV4fZQ.text: Best pizza I've ever had - Salami and rocket!

MK9GSIOl_OXUHjPg0Q5WcA.text: Great pizza, atmosphere was great. Service was excellent. Yep, I'll be coming back for sure!

0yICraUA_nY1vB_UKRqs6g.text: Around the same time when legendary Pizza Pilgrims opened their first permanent restaurant in Soho, not far away over in Covent Garden, another highly praised mobile pizza business went permanent: Homeslice. I had my first Homeslice Pizza back in the days, when Qype was still Qype and they did a great summer party at a place in Brick Lane. Besides Big Apple Hot Dogs and other traders I cannot remember, Homeslice had a stall and were giving out pizza in quantities. They had a very busy evening, and if you ever tasted a Homeslice pizza, you know why! Sadly, I rarely had the chance to enjoy their pizza ever after  until now. As soon as I heard about the new shop, I decided to head down to Covent Garden to check out their restaurant. It is tucked away from the busy crowds and has quite a few places. It feels more informal and social than many other places. The menu of Homeslice Pizza is somewhat limited. No starters, no desserts, just pizza. Huge pizzas or pizza by the slice. Especially pizza by the slice is a great offering that you do not find at most pizzerias. If you are not too hungry or want to mix a little bit, this is perhaps the best idea since sliced bread. I had the simple margherita and can fully recommend it. The dough is very thin, flexible, yet still crispy, the toppings are tasty and the whole thing is one of the best pizzas you can get. Homeslice Pizza. Check it our yourself.

xLOrvIkO5dgsPgovNK59rw.text: The pizza here is amazing! And the staff really is helpful. I was waiting for the rest of my party to arrive before they seated me and the man was very welcoming and trying to make sure even though they were busy, they could accommodate us right away when everyone got there. It is a small place and gets busy because its delicious, so you might have to wait. They have slices to take away as well. We had the half salami/ rocket & half mushroom, ricotta & pumpkin seeds (SOOOO DELICIOUS!!), and half scallop, garlic and pancetta, half lamb shoulder and goats cheese (even better!!!) . I cannot recommend this place enough if you want a fun girls night out or a great date night.

WyAEjbq9zxLipOHpIehqKg.text: Homeslice is perfection. The atmosphere is relaxed, the servers are friendly, the music is just right, and the pizza is amazing! Definitely one of the best places I've been to eat in London.  Recommend this 100%!

b4xyDZr-xl1zUL5yefo66Q.text: Worth the wait for exceptionally good pizza. Generally younger crowd in a small, open setting.

IVltYcRlCWmvpIjctOo5Mg.text: Been a while since I found a reason to frequent Neal's Yard and today I have one.  Margherita is to pizza joints what club sandwiches are to hotel bars and from the delectable slice I had today, I believe Homeslice is going to make many people happy over the days and years ahead.

XxZsHlG__--lMqzTePK_nw.text: This is a fine Homeslice pizza and when its fresh the taste is wonderful. I would not recommend to have it during night times because its rarely fresh and tasty

RQvXvgXsxJTbhFOyhfPJmg.text: Following the good reviews on Yelp we were expecting big things from this place, sadly we were let down by the unorganised seating service. Pizzas were OK, good size, everything you would expect from a pizza oven, house red was a little ropey!. Shame really

OqfP75AwAuagaCo2v6XmHA.text: Really nice place with amazing huge pizza ! And cheap as well. Had a great time there.

AumKO17llsKaUWrO8LYcxA.text: We loved our lunch at Homeslice Pizza during our recent visit to London. On a gorgeous afternoon, this is the place to go. Neil's Yard is so charming and the food, beer, and wine at Homeslice were a perfect addition to that charm. The pizzas "look" huge, but are very thinly made ~ so you eat more than you think (and still have some to take home). We had half caprese, half asparagus/ricotta/pepper. We loved it and highly recommend!!!

kQNtcbwoVZhks1xBM9gqvg.text: Awesome, huge pizzas. Very tasty. No reservations though so get there in time to nab a seat.

AaUsocWO90jG_kPfmP0Txg.text: We're found Homeslice on Yelp while searching for food that was a relatively short walking distance from our AirBnB in Covent Garden. We'd heard Yelp wasn't as reliable in Europe but this place certainly lived up to the hype! Located in "Neal's Yard" - a cozy little hidden courtyard full of excellent food and drink definitely worth checking out - Homeslice delivered some of the best pizza I've ever had. Be prepared to wait upwards of an hour if you go later in the evening and don't have a reservation (we passed the time with a beer at Craft Beer Co right around the corner). Once we were seated though the service was fast and the food was delivered quickly. We choose one pizza with a garlic based sauce and some white cheeses, and another more traditional Italian meat style pizza. Both would hold their own against some of the better pizza joints in San Diego. Highly recommend this spot for anyone looking for good pizza or a fun night out in Covent Garden!

SZEIU7Fxca_bC8bJRRgF2g.text: There's little for me to add to all those who have waxed lyrical about the incredible Pizza at homeslice. I approached this place with caution, despite the generous reviews on yelp. So let's get personal, I popped in hoping for a snack and despite the size of the pizza, the thinness of the crust makes this snack-worthy and meal-worthy. I ordered 3 slices between two people, they even give you a slicer to share their slices (blatantly know that they're too big). The pizzas are very thin, so a lot of folding technique will be involved here, not to worry, all those origami folds weren't mastered in vain. We had the margherita, courgette and artichoke, and a salami (and something something pizza). So many things about homeslice are great, but the best thing is the well seasoned and perfectly baked dough - I'd be happy to eat just crust, and I'm not even a bread-lover (I know, I know, judge away). The margarita was tasty and tomato-y. I like tomato. The courgette and artichoke pizza was delicious. So much so, I've already decided that I'm having a whole one to myself next time. There were some other great choices challked up on the board, like the cauliflower cheese, aubergine and spinach pizza, or the pulled pork with mint pesto or something pizza.I didn't go down the route of drinks on this occasion, but they seem to have beer, prosecco and other good things on tap which I will need to try. All I know, is that I need to come here again. It's phenomenal.

uDnbNHrm1y0Ba1ews9XShQ.text: Im gonna get onthe band wagon and say this is a great little pizza joint!!! I don't know if its the best pizza I have ever had, its good and the novelty 20" size (two toping choice possible) is a great idea but to be honest it was a little bit floppy when cut. - a few people complain the cutters are blunt, and yeah they are but they get the job done!We turned up on a friday evening and had to put our name down for a table of 6. We were told it would be 30 minutes and turned up a little late, this was lucky as the table wasnt yet ready. When it was ready turned out they thought we said 3 people, to there credit they quickly sourced another table for three but in a different paet of the restaurant...... after a little chat with some other patrons we managed to get a table altogether. They have a good selection of beers and we had a cracking meal. The waitress was helpful with suggestions and also joined in on the lad banter that was going on. My one concern with this place is its very small and if you turn up at the wrong time you may just have to go hungry. :-(

Q-_rvWmpx03UfOK9wWV5YA.text: There's a mix of communal tables and more private 2 seaters around the edge. Only slightly more private though as they crammed in to close to each other that the couple next to us had to move their table about a foot for me to get through the gap! The vibe is cool here though and it reminded me a lot of some of the pizza joints in New York, with the pizza taking up most of the table, no cutlery and paper plates.Our good friend Kirsty was with us this evening so we ordered a few a Camden Hells Lager each and got down to choosing our toppings. Every option sounded awesome but we settled on half Goat Shoulder with red kale & sumac yoghurt and half Mushroom, ricotta, pumpkin seeds & chilli flakes.Both were gorgeous. Crispy, slightly chewy and tasty dough with generous helpings of each topping. The combinations work brilliantly on their own or in this 50/50 style, especially the tender goat with cool yoghurt.We really enjoyed Homeslice, it's definitely one of the best pizza places in London. It can be a wait to get in but they take your number so you're free to go off and grab a drink in the meantime. I'm very keen to go back and their interesting, exciting toppings certainly help them stand apart from the competition.

IJOJ60IBi64Rp8zdEGqMLQ.text: My favourite pizza in London! We got a huge 20 inch, half and half pizza for 20 pounds. But you can buy by the slice (which are substantial!) at £4 each. There is a a good variety of interesting/more adventurous toppings compared to most pizza restaurants. There were 3 veggie options. I had a veggie pizza which was densely packed with mushrooms and ricotta. The base is nice and thin, but was a little charred in places for my taste. My boyfriend got the brisket pizza which was a little sparse in toppings, but he assured me that the rich flavour of the sauce and meat made up for this. Very yummy! This will be my pizza place of choice from now on!

ViciOb1JpguJalXLr1i4Jg.text: I love this place! Best staff ever! Need I more exclamation marks!?! I took a date here, sure we're not together anymore but boy did the pizza bring us closer together LOL! After dinner there, I was told that this was his best date ever and I think it may be because of this place. The atmosphere was buzzing and the music was spot on to my taste. The seating was also highly in demand so you can tell how popular this place is. It is rightly so a hidden gem that is not given enough credit. I have friends in NYC who have family that own a stone-baked pizza company and I mentioned this place. I told them that they have competition trans Atlantic. Haha!

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Half & Half pizza
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Yum!

RDJAiBgSh2ROntdlassN_A.text: One of my favourite places in London! I've only ever stopped by for a quick slice in the middle of the afternoon so I've never had a problem getting seated. Excellent, gourmet Brooklyn-style pizza and the interior and vibe remind me of getting tapas in Spain.

W9HGKqks-kP_uu3fxbPtRA.text: This is going to be a suspiciously short review, in part because there's really not much to say about HomeSlice.They do Pizza. With a capital P. No pasta, no sides, just pizza. £4/slice or £20 for a 20 inch pizza that's begging to be shared by at least two.Pizza. So what? Why not go to Domino's?Because this is the best pizza in London. Straight out of the pizza oven come almost impossibly thin and crispy pizzas with few ingredients. The margherita is a standout as a direct result of this - the ingredients do the talking. Imagine the best pizza you've had - this is better. I'm a particular fan, somewhat bizarrely, of the crust - it's jam-packed full of flavour.My one gripe with HomeSlice is that it's ever-so-slightly inconsistent. Pizzas can come slightly under- or over-cooked, and with quite significant variations in the amount of toppings - like a distinct dearth of mozzarella on my last visit.Everything I've just said negatively about HomeSlice, however, is entitled and should be ignored. That I'm able to be so bloody picky about pizza in London is quite frankly incredible. But when you've tasted pizza perfection at HomeSlice, continued pursuit of that perfection becomes addictive.

gI3EfRp557QYgXKFN6t1Sw.text: We just came back from Napoli where we were eating at L'antica Pizzeria Da Michele, so I was not looking forward to a pizzeria in London. However, this place did not disappoint! We bought a large pizza half veggie and half carne for the meat eaters. My veggie half had zucchini and artichokes and was super yummy. I did try a piece of the salami and rocket, after pulling off the salami and it was super delish. The 3 of us were very full at the end of £20 (not including drinks). Very affordable and good value for London! I recommend this place!

R060MzLQ6qihfSLEhqBwwg.text: Best pizza in London. We used to order takeaway when we lived in Covent Garden - the pizza restaurant vibe isn't really my thing. But trust me, nowhere in London will you find pizza this incredible. Everything is tasty. My personal favourite is their chorizo, corn and coriander pizza (trust me, it just works). They also often have a lovely courgette pizza with a white base. Everything is delicious and cooked to perfection. Highly recommend.

JG3HUh-Zm3gqJ6C0AMcIRA.text: **Edited it from 4 to 5 stars because I keep craving their slices so I guess I really like this place!**For the record, I have yet to actually dine here because somehow I'm always the only one who wants pizza (sadface, I think I need better friends) but hooray for slices! Okay, so four slices for £20 kind of sucks compared to a whole pizza for £20, but when you can only finish two (mind you, they are huge), it's £8 really well spent. Plus, I don't know any other pizza joint in London that does slices (if you do, hit me up!)I feel like you either love it or hate it here. The first time I was like, why is the base so chewy?? I don't understandd.. This is not pizza?!?! And by the fifth slice I think my jaw was a little tired.. How I even ate that much I do not know. But I now know this to be 'real' new york pizza and hey, I like it. So it's sometimes too charred at the bottom and its floppyness gets annoying at times but they really do the best flavours!They used to have this amazing mushroom one with maybe feta and pumpkin seeds with the best balsamic glaze drizzled over. I can't explain it but there's something about the ambitious complexity of flavours that you don't ever expect on pizza. It's so unassuming! I really like mushrooms and have had them foamed, freeze dried and turned into sand at fancy fine dining places but this is my favourite mushroom 'dish' OF ALL TIME. Well, was :( :( :( :( :( (I REALLY AM VERY SAD ABOUT THIS PLEASE BRING IT BACK!)I'd go into more detail about the other varieties but this rambling review is long enough so in short, yes it's crowded and busy and there's a line at any sensible hour but noooooo, just get take away, take the slice out of its little baggie, fold the plate in half and sort of slide the pizza into your mouth as you walk around seven dials. Simple. LIFE SORTED.

HKPlQWHiNlgQNfhwP4XFRw.text: Not to be confused with Home Slice in Austin, Texas (which is great pizza in its own right), this place is the best pizza in London if not outside of Napoli.  The crust is great, the san marzano sauce is fantastic...all of that is good.  Do you know what makes it though?  The little bits of kosher salt in the pizza crust.  It compliments the sweet san marzano tomato sauce so perfectly.We were told the wait was 30 minutes but only waited 5.  Service was outstanding and the place has great local beer.  The red chili oil is super spicy and a great addition to your pizza.

ieLtJhHDUDNhC1DfDgbA3w.text: Great lunch time pizza joint tucked in Neal's Yard laneway off the backstreets of Covent Garden. You have a choice of a giant £20 pizza which could feed up to 4 (I'd say 3 if you like to eat) or £4 a slice (almost a quarter of a giant pizza). Wood fire oven pizza that is closer to Roman and NY style than Neopolitan style pizza. Interesting toppings like haggis but also traditional ones appear on the menu. Just the right amount of toppings to keep it light. An airy space with indoor and outdoor seating, both shared tables and individual tables. Prompt and attentive service aiming to please. No reservations and the queue can get long but the turnover is fast. Not my first choice for pizza but I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Margherita with salame, rocket and shaved parmesan flakes / courgettes, artichokes on a cheese base

VvbYYmuaiWwKq3HWii9GsA.text: There aren't enough words in the English language to describe how good Homeslice is. I won't say anything else but I'll leave you with this: the goat shoulder pizza was amazing. We were skeptical at first as well but boy it was good, we shoulder had more!

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. One half is the goat shoulder, the other is the mushroom, ricotta, pumpkin seeds and olives.

_bzrlmnRLa9eRzAi-RcJIg.text: This place serves pizza that is beyond sublime. I ate alone, and two slices were the perfect amount of food more me -- the slices are huge. I had the margherita and the salami, rocket, & parmesan. Both were excellent: the pizza is thin, there was a perfect amount of crust, and the toppings are quality. Because the pizza is so thin and the slices are so large, it can be a bit of a handful to try to hold and eat them, so get ready to be a little messy and use a lot of napkins. There is no silverware provided, so mentally prepare yourself. (I myself do not usually eat pizza with silverware, but in this instance it would have been nice since the pizza is a little challenging to tackle otherwise.)The place was extremely crowded but not unpleasantly so, and the hostess gave me a very accurate estimate of how long I'd be waiting for a table. I didn't have to wait long since I was eating alone, but larger groups should expect a bit of a wait. Additionally, you can give them your mobile number and browse the shops or get a drink while waiting for your table (I would recommend this as there's not really room to stand around and wait inside the restaurant). If you do stand and wait near the front door, take the time to look over the menu on the board -- they don't bring paper menus to your table, so if you have poor eyesight (like myself) you'll end up needing your server to give you a quick overview of the menu. The service was quick, polite, and pleasant. For what it's worth, if you're not particularly comfortable eating alone this is not the place to try it out. You WILL be put at a table with another party as the space is so small and it's so popular.Despite any short-comings with lack of silverware or the crowded space, this pizza is the best I've found in London and absolutely worth a stop in.

19cwG1XBL2vQwqK0miNkPQ.text: Fantastic pizza large floppy slices with fantastic dough and sauce. Super crowded so we had to take out but totally worth it. The location was cool kind of a back alley super swank and an awesome place to hang out.

WCtYtpUQvpWWUuLHi47tGg.text: Who likes white pizzas? Normally, not I, said the Katie. The artichoke and courgette pizza from Homeslice? Sorry, can't talk. Mouth full.Tucked in the somewhat hard to find Neal's Yard, I was so excited to see my favourite pizza food stall go brick and mortar. This is arguably my favourite pizza in London. Now, I know this is a controversial topic, so please don't jump all over me with how much you were disappointed once you tried it based on this review. If you like SUPER crispy pizza, this won't be for you. If you like super 'authentic' (whatever that means), this won't be for you.If you like interesting, if not experimental, toppings, intense and well thought out flavour, doughy, well-salted crust that is crisp on the outside, but delightfully chewy in the centre, this may be for you. You sort of have to fold it in half to eat it. Yes, eat it with your hands.£20 will buy you a massive, 20inch pizza. You can choose two different pizzas and go half and half on the same 'pie' (as they say in America). They also have beer (just one kind?), and wine that they let you pour yourself. They come around with a ruler afterwards to see how much has been drunk and charge you based on that. Their tomato sauce is really nice-- super tangy. Andrew M. and I tried a half artichoke/courgette, half pork belly pizza. I preferred the lemony artichoke and courgette (with a garlic non-tomato base), but both were tasty. Next time, I want to try the basic fresh mozzarella/tomato/basil 'caprese' pizza. a good standard by which to judge pizza ingredients.**UPDATE: The Caprese is delicious too!!!! Possibly my favourite. Straight foward, tangy, and SO fresh tasting.

S8h0U_KSfQYKb0Axw4gluA.text: I may be British but I hate queuing. So you can imagine how I feel about the trend of London restaurants making me wait in line for  the pleasure of eating food.Luckily Homeslice avoid my wrath by letting you leave a number and wander off for a drink. Add to that that they serve basically the best pizza I've ever eaten and they've avoided my ire entirely.With an ever-changing menu a return trip can be a little heart-wrenching (oh, Lincolnshire poacher how could you desert me?) but their menu options are always amazing and original (mint pesto? sure, why not?). The 20inch half and half is definitely the way to go and I've, so far, never been disappointed.I'm also overly fond of the giant wine bottles that they then measure to work out your bill; but that's primarily because that, paired with a giant pizza, means I can pretend to be a borrower. Always a good time.I've been here a few times now and will no doubt be back again. I just hope that they manage to open a larger version at some point - it is sometimes nice not to eat with a stranger's elbow in your side...

zCUAqNR8lEZEYS-Rcjp0zA.text: My favorite pizza place back home in Texas is called Homeslice.  And now, my favorite pizza in London is called Homeslice.  Coincidence?  Well, yes, I think so.Homeslice is tucked into that little Neal's Yard nook of hippiedom in Covent Garden so it might be a little hard to find.  It was fairly cramped inside, but we made the best of it nonetheless. Seriously though, the size of the tables is my one gripe about this place.  You have a booth for people to sit in, but the table is maybe only 2/3 the length of the booth.  Weird.But the pizza!  Oh, the pizza!  It's thin crust, which I find to be a necessity.  The pizza is a bit floppy and does require folding for munching, but it takes you back to an American sloppiness without the British politeness of eating pizza with utensils that I love.  We tried four types that evening, but the standout for me was the bone marrow pizza.  The oxtail and horseradish is a great flavor combo, but when I grabbed my slice, all the sauce came careening off, so that was a bit of a bummer.  The menu is super simple, and if you missed it on the board when you walked in, the waitstaff has pictures of it on ipads for you to take a gander.The waitstaff is hipster quirky for sure, but also super friendly and didn't even give us the stinkeye once, despite our closing the place down for the evening.I've already sung the praises of Homeslice to others, so I will hopefully be back soon!

3kJB_kuGHvFGOfcKdos-yQ.text: The best pizza in London.  It gets busy because they serve the best pizza in London.  We were fortunate enough to have a coffee shop near home that did Pizza nights on a Thursday made by the HomeSlice folk..when they decided to open up a restaurant we had to go.  We come here with the kids and amazingly they are always ok with us taking up so much space (with prams and highchairs..kids take up more room than you think).Always fresh ingredients and the base is just perfect.  They get the right combination of ingredients every time..seriously they do.  And just to make the whole thing a little more perfect, they serve Prosecco by the glass.Go..you need to eat this pizza..Now!

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom

1fGv0dZb4ys6_LaYXjoFcw.text: I wish I had read Camie T.s review on the forks prior to visiting Homeslice! It definitely was a bit tricky to eat this pizza with no utensils.We opted for a half half of oxtail and salami which set us back 20GBP for a giant 20in pizza. They also offer some pizzas by the slice. The pizza crust was thin and crispy which was great for the first couple of slices but as the minutes ticked by it inevitably got softer and harder to eat. This is where the fork would have come in handy! The oxtail was good but a bit heavy on the horseradish. The salami was yum. Lots of crispy salami pieces topped with rocket!Seating can be a cramped here and it was hard to get in and out as the seats are pretty close together.

wGPib-iZhVbgALcerx9mWQ.text: Such good value and delicious! Definitely come here for lunch instead of dinner to avoid the queue.

IianUC7G1JgPMtEDp4foMg.text: Absolutely delicious and hands down the best pizza I have had in a long time.The base itself wasn't exciting but the variety and uniqueness of the toppings is where this place excels. Very fresh tasting with bold exciting flavours.The sumac yoghurt was a tad too liberally applied so overpowered the rest of the toppings but nonetheless was truly great.The real showstopper was the BBQ brisket which was an inspired choice.These pizza's are huge so one can be comfortably shared by two people unless you feel brave and go for one each (I did and had LOTS of leftovers).Drink selection was limited but they offered me a Brixton beer which is now a new fave.Win win.

HwPDxnkL1OZL_j-NjX7_uQ.text: Went for a Friday lunch with some colleagues from work.Three types of pizzas ca nbe bought by slice. The rest need to be bought as a £20 pizza - its recommended you share these and the restaurant will happily make them half one topping and half another.Positives:+ Pizzas (I tried 2) were really tasty, we finished all of our pizza easily.+ There are also some imaginative options (e.g. the cauliflower cheese pizza)+ Service was quick+ Decent value for moneyOn the other hand:- Limited tables for groups of 6+- Most choices require you to buy the 20" pizza for £20 so not great unless you're at least 2 people, really hungry (I reckon I could eat a whole one myself if necessary, they're quite thin) or happy to take leftovers home- Our crusts were very salty, I liked the taste but that much salt must be v bad...Overall: We've become very picky about our Friday lunches as spoilt for choice around Covent Garden but we agreed unanimously that we'll come back here. Well worth giving it a try if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Half and half
Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Cauliflower cheese pizza

4-GfijrZ8s_sxXCkaUk1KA.text: Found this spot by accident on a day where my boyfriend and I were starving! Thankfully service was quick and we were handed our 20" in minutes. Like the feel to the place. Pizza was does not have the traditional toppings but they worked well together. Also, the crust was thin and tasted good on its own. Would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Homeslice Neal's Yard - London, United Kingdom. Half anchovy and half chorizo

oO_BkMIh3zM-Rvv4JtAMaw.text: Tha place is very nice and laid back, kind of "berlin-style". So, the atmosphere is pretty good but the pizza was not anything special. It was extremely oily and with small amount of cheese. I would suggest this place only for its feel-good atmosphere.

iejhiRgk5bmUczHbLSyBXg.text: My friends all wanted to give Homeslice a go after hearing great things but the stumbling block is that I'm gluten-free. Now, I pondered my options and thought 'well I can either sit at home and hear about what a wonderful time everyone had catching up or I can go and spend time with my friends'. I obviously opted for the latter and myself and a few of my friends contacted Homeslice to inform them I was coming and ask what options there were...None. Now I'd been expecting this, so asked them if I could bring a lunchbox so I could at least eat alongside my friends but they wouldn't even accommodate this request. So not wanting to cause a fuss, I settled on some food in the pub where we were having drinks and then we headed to Homeslice. We had to wait a long time for the table and the staff weren't that helpful. My friends ordered their pizzas and whilst they enjoyed them none of them were waxing lyrical although I half suspect this may have been for my benefit. All in all, it just didn't seem to live up to the hype for my friends and also left a sour note that they were so unwilling to accommodate me even if I brought my own food.

8b8zYd6jaQ6u178D_EI7Tw.text: Located in one of the cutest areas of London - Neal's Yard - Homeslice's buzzing, loud atmosphere is a contrast to the romantic and quiet backalley (in a good way). The waitresses are not-in-your-face cool, maneuvering around the many little tables with giant pizzas and a good attitude.The restaurant is filled with 20somethings, primarily in groups of 2, shouting at each other over jaw-droppingly/conversation-startingy large pizzas with unlikely toppings. The fairly small room is quickly filled with the impressive pizza oven, the cooks throwing their dough in the air, the waiters' explanations of how this all works, the loud music and all the chatter. You get one giant 20 inch pizza for £20 which you can split in half by topping. There are 10 choices only written on a chalkboard, because menus are so 2014.We went for the classic salami, rocket and parmesan, with mushroom, ricotta, pumpkin seeds and chili flakes (but, were vey tempted by the goat shoulder with red kale and sumac yoghurt!). Pizzas arrived quickly and were eaten off paper plates - who needs table space for plates when you have a giant pizza? You get your own pizza slicer, which in our case led to some irregularly sized slices... Sharing napkins and condiments between tables is encouraged and adds to the warm buzz of the place.The dough was thin, the crust was soft, the toppings are very well put together. The ricotta was so fresh, the salami wasn't greasy - you can almost pretend you're eating healthily. The chili flakes and pumpkin seeds gave the pizza a kick without making it too alien. I found the bottom of the pizza a little smokier than I would have preferred, but devoured all the crust, because it was incredible. Generally, one of the best pizzas in London.We went at 10pm and there was no queue, but larger groups behind us couldn't find an available table anymore. Definitely worth a try in a small group at an awkward hour!USP: Giant sharing pizzas, good price, gourmet toppings, (cool name).Go with: Somebody you don't mind shouting at, that can both share and eat. I'd say bff, sibling, fourth date.Price: Low - £10 will fill you up!Comparison: Similar style to Franco Manca in terms of interesting toppings, dough was more similar to Pizza Pilgrims, but major wins on size of pizza for price, and collaborative atmosphere.

r_7X1pPt5OK0c2hXtxfV8Q.text: One of my top 2 pizza spots in London (pizza is like a staple part of my diet so I've tried a lot of different places around), and is comparable only to Franco Manca. For 20quid, you can get a 20 inch pizza and for 4quid you can get a generously sized slice. If you're coming during a peak time or with a larger group, be prepared to wait 1 hr+. But if you like pizza, I 10/10 recommend because your taste buds will thank you even though your really tight skinny jeans will not.

Yz_OnBgca5TbVRE3qF_vrA.text: Who would have thought you could get good pizza in London. Being originally from the NY Metropolitan area, we are pizza snobs. Now we reside in Florida where pizza goes to die. I had read the reviews and figured, what the heck, lets try it. We stumbled into Neal's Yard, a cozy alcove of shops in Covent Garden/Soho and found a line out the door. There additionally were patrons sitting at the outside tables and doing takeout. Just maybe...So we went inside and were told it would be about 40 minutes before a section would be open. Folks this is community sitting and then some. There is not a spot to waste and forget about private conversations. Noise level is extremely high but that is a spacial thing. The chalkboard gives you the daily list of available pizzas; you can purchase a whole 20 incher or individual slices. Since it was just me and my wife we went for the slices of two different varieties. Thinking back, the 20 incher would have served us better even though it doesn't fit on the table. The poor girl next to us was having an awful time trying to hold her plate and eat at the same time. The slices were large and thin; so thin it flipped down and was foldable like real pizza. The combinations were not crazy and made real sense. Delicious with a good amount of sauce (good pizza should have the appropriate ratio of sauce to cheese leaning towards more sauce). The service was adequate and the wait staff should consider being gymnasts as they wiggled their way through the tight spaces expertly. We left sufficiently filled with enough room in our bellies to seek out gelato later. While we can't give it five stars as that is saved only for the very best, we do feel their effort in creating an actual real live pizza in a country not known for food is well worth high praise; praise I unfortunately cannot give to my current adopted home.

dL3aFWhfdTyifysnrnrjVw.text: You will need at least two people to finish off the 20 inches monster, solo diners are best to order by the slice, however the choices are much more limited (only three, all classic flavours such as Margherita). To sum it up, a great pizza joint with some creative factor, I would more than happy to return to try other flavours in the future.

ksRb5_cR-IEK-FOjJ2X-zg.text: If you're in the area or a pizza loving freak like me Homeslice is one of the places to try. The 20inch pizzas will leave you full for days. The different types of ingredients they have for the pizzas are all lovely, and the best thing is you can do half and half - The best of both worlds. Also if you think a 20inch pizza is too much they also do pizza slices by the slice. These slices are huge!I've been there a few times now and each time the experience has been great. The atmosphere and staff always makes you go back. It's definitely good for birthdays, dates, hang outs, and if you just want pizza.

EMtbjHNTUaiOX9VI6y4xvg.text: This is one of my go-to places for a work week lunch. Pro tip, go in with three others and split a whole pie for £5.00, each.   Super pro tip, you can select two toppings for a half-half pie.I have eaten my way through most of the toppings:SALAMI, ROCKET & PARMESAN - this is a fan favourite. My coworkers are always campaigning for this topping. This is a straightforward, traditional pizza, no explanation necessary. Personally, I am not a fan of Salami on pizza.    CHORIZO, CORN & CORIANDER - This is another group favourite. I like it better than the Salami, but it does tend to get a bit greasy if you don't eat it when it is at its peak heat. I quite like the cheese (maybe a cheddar, or some other sharp cheese) used on this one.CALABRIAN PEPPERS, CHERVIL & LINCOLNSHIRE POACHER - This is the all-time fan favourite and why Home Slice is earning 5 stars. Everyone loves this pizza. THIS IS A MUST ORDER!GOAT SHOULDER WITH RED KALE & SUMAC YOGHURT (G) - Most of my coworkers are off put by this "exotic meat". The goat holds up well in the pizza oven. I have never had kale on a pizza before, but after having it at Home Slice, I don't know why! Keep an open mind; give goat shoulder and kale a chance. OXTAIL & HORSERADISH CREAM (T) - Again, most of my coworkers were not having oxtail. But again, oxtail holds up really well in the pizza oven. Plus, I am a sucker for anything with horseradish.  If you want a unique pizza eating experience, go for the goat shoulder or oxtail (well.. half you need to get the pepper topping, obvi).

6bGvsUAehj1-y9mqTuPI9A.text: If I am around Covent Garden around lunch time or dinner and I haven't ate yet, I like to sneak by here for a delicious slice of pizza. Thin, crispy and flavourable! Great friendly service. It can get hectic because it gets really busy. You can eat the pizza in the colourful courtyard but probably better in summer than winter.

MqeDTQsugpt1lG30L7WiQw.text: 1/2 empty restaurant:  can I sit and have a drink and my friends will be here in 10 minutes?  "No."  Ok... Your restaurant is 1/2 empty, no need to be so bitchy about it.  I'd understand at 8 on Friday nights, but before 6 on Tuesday?  With nary a queue waiting? There is just no need for this kind of attitude.It's fine, we'll just go somewhere else, bitchface.  You don't have patience or kindness for me, I don't have the patience to deal with you either.

MDR1wldl6CRrsmsMKEUkjQ.text: I had two bites of my first slice here and thought, I have to blog about this! I have to write a review. Although I neither write a blog or reviews. It's enough to say, the pizza here is Amazing. You either buy slices (£4) or share a large pizza for £20. Definitely doable for two people, or perfect to share between 3. We had half/half with pepperoni, rocket and parmesan, and chorizo, corn and coriander. The sauce on the salami pizza. Simply perfect. The chorizo pizza has a yellow creamed corn sauce which was lovely too, and a bit different. I'm coming back to try the caprese pizza I've heard is The Best Ever. Still, I don't feel we missed out on my first visit here.It can be busy at lunch time, but the wait was only 20 min. They take your number so you can walk around covent garden and before you know it your table is ready. Definitely worth the wait!

otsTBx6tW_V4GZ-jaUpuOA.text: This is the way pizza is meant to be. Thin, lightly charred, wood-fired crust. Delicious sauce. Gourmet ingredients.Staff is very friendly and master at managing the masses storming the gates (and they are always storming the gates.)The place itself is chill and fun. Long, shared tables (count on a quasi-public conversation and the occasional bumped elbows), but everyone is jovial and having fun.First time I discovered this place, I ate there three times that first week. Now I have to force myself to only go twice (for my waistline) as Homeslice is just...that...good.

CafX4shZheRj3yofetNF6A.text: Pammie and I came here based on what we;d heard from other people. It was a place we 'just had to eat at'. I was not disappointed.We opted for pizza by the slice (20" seemed a bit much for lunch!) so we got to try three different toppings. They all tasted amazing. The mushroom one was perhaps a little too mushroomey (I know. I never thought I'd say that), but they were all really tasty.It's a very communal eating kind of place. You sit on long tables with strangers and attempt to eat the floppiest pizza in the world. If you order a 20" that's pretty much fine. They give you a pizza cutter - so you just cut smaller slices. If you are given slices however. you have only your hands. They are massive (yay) but you have no way of cutting them without getting covered in the sauce / topping (you just tear into it). I know this is a minor thing but Pammie and I had a few shops to go to afterwards and the idea of going clothes shopping with sticky pizza hands isn't the greatest thing in the world.It would have been nice to have some wet wipes or something to take the edge off the stickiness.The service was pretty attentive, given how busy they were. We had to wait Nando's-esq in a corner by the door for a few minutes. Which was ok, if inconvenient.I'd recommend coming here if you're in the area. Just expect to leave a little sticky.

i5s6a1LC9lopEd4mtelFRg.text: I really liked this place.  The pizza is very thin and crispy with excellent ingredients.  So thin in fact that if you don't eat it within 10 minutes or so, it starts to flop out.  I doubt this pizza travels well, but it was delicious right out of the wood fired oven.  Did a half and half pizza because they only offer one size, large!  The sweet corn and chorizo side was soooo good.  The chorizo was excellent and really made the pizza.  The mushroom, ricotta and pepitas side was pretty awesome as well.  The ricotta is super creamy.  Really nice.Got a couple of slices of margherita as well.  Really crispy from the second bake.  really good.Love the fact that they bring you a huge bottle of wine and you help yourself as much as you like (they measure when you are done and then you pay for the amount of glasses you drank).    Offer whole pizzas and slices.  Very simple menu, very nicely done.I'll be back for this.  For sure.
